column1: The Pit Room////Rated as one of the Top 50 BBQ joints in Texas
column2: but not sure if it deserves it. Maybe because it was dinner; I've learned the best BBQ is served at high noon. Pork rib is a little tough
column3: brisket fat is not adequately rendered
column4: and turkey is not moist (after counter guy said it was one of the best things they serve). Corn Elote was overcooked. The best cue doesn't need sauce
column5: but this does and I didn't care for it as it was too vinegary. Traditional dill pickles and white bread were non-traditional
